title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (October 24, 2019).

Trump said he is lifting U.S. sanctions against Turkey as its forces suspended their offensive against the Kurds in northern Syria and instituted a separate agreement with Moscow that sent Russian security forces to begin patrolling nearby.

A Pentagon official appeared before the House panels leading the impeachment inquiry after a Republican protest delayed the proceedings by several hours.

Two Giuliani associates pleaded not guilty to charges tied to an alleged scheme to illegally influence U.S. politicians.

British police are investigating how the bodies of 39 people wound up in a truck container at an industrial park near London.

The EU's Tusk is asking leaders to give the U.K. a delay on Brexit until Jan. 31, after Britain formally requested an extension.

Canada's Trudeau ruled out any coalition pact with rival parties to ensure his Liberal Party remains in power in a minority government.

Morales claimed victory in Bolivia's disputed election and accused the opposition of trying to overthrow his government.

PG&E began cutting power to 179,000 customers in 17 California counties to head off potential wildfires.

A hole in the ozone layer located near the South Pole is the smallest it has been since first being discovered in the 1980s, NASA said.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 24, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
